[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'14V663000', u'Conequence': u'An incorrect label may result in the vehicle being overloaded, increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov. ', u'Component': u'EQUIPMENT:OTHER:LABELS', u'Summary': u'Gulf States Toyota, Inc. (Gulf States) is recalling certain model year 2015 Toyota Tacoma vehicles manufactured September 2, 2014, to October 15, 2014.  The affected vehicles may contain an incorrect Load Carrying Capacity Modification Label.  As a result, these vehicles fail to comply with the requirements of Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard No. 110, "Tire Selection and Rims for Passenger Cars."', u'Remedy': u'Gulf States has notified owners, and dealers will install an accurate label, free of charge.  The recall began December 1, 2014.  Owners may contact Gulf States customer service at 1-800-444-1074. ', u'ModelYear': u'2015', u'Model': u'TACOMA', u'Make': u'TOYOTA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1413950400000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Gulf States Toyota, Inc.'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'15V099000', u'Conequence': u'Improperly inflated tires may increase the risk of a vehicle crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'TIRES | WHEELS', u'Summary': u'Toyota Motor Engineering & Manufacturing (Toyota) is recalling certain model year 2015 Tacoma pickup trucks manufactured August 7, 2014, to December 22, 2014. The affected vehicles may have had their tires and wheels changed to TRD PRO accessory tires and wheels, causing the inflation information on the tire placard to be incorrect which may result in the tire being improperly inflated. As such, these vehicles fail to comply with the requirements of Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard (FMVSS) No. 110, "Tire Selection and Rims and Motor Home/Recreation Vehicle Trailer Load Carrying Capacity Information for Motor Vehicles with a GVWR of 4,536 kilograms (10,000 pounds) or less."', u'Remedy': u'Toyota will notify owners, and dealers will send a revised tire placard with correct tire size and inflation information to owners, free of charge. The recall began March 13, 2015.  Owners may contact Toyota customer service at 1-800-331-4331.', u'ModelYear': u'2015', u'Model': u'TACOMA', u'Make': u'TOYOTA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1424667600000-0500)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Toyota Motor Engineering & Manufacturing'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'14V828000', u'Conequence': u'Accessories that detach from a vehicle may result in a vehicle crash and/or personal injury.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'EQUIPMENT', u'Summary': u'Southeast Toyota Distributors, LLC (SET) is recalling certain model year 2014-2015 Toyota 4Runner, Tacoma, FJ Cruiser, Land Cruiser, RAV4, Scion FRS, and XB vehicles.  The affected vehicles may have accessories installed by SET, such as running boards or other items, that were incorrectly installed.  The accessory attaching fasteners were not tightened with the proper torque, possibly causing the accessory to detach from the vehicle. ', u'Remedy': u"SET will notify owners, and dealers will inspect and tighten the affected bolts, free of charge. The recall began February 23, 2015. Owners may contact SET customer service at 1-866-405-4226. SET's number for this recall is SET-14B.", u'ModelYear': u'2015', u'Model': u'TACOMA', u'Make': u'TOYOTA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1419915600000-0500)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Southeast Toyota Distributors, LLC'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V425000', u'Conequence': u'If the hood scoop detaches, it may become a road hazard, increasing the risk of a crash.  ', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov. ', u'Component': u'EQUIPMENT | STRUCTURE:BODY:HOOD:HINGE AND ATTACHMENTS', u'Summary': u'Southeast Toyota Distributors, LLC (SET) is recalling certain 2011-2016 Toyota Tacoma and 4Runner vehicles equipped with accessory hood scoops installed by SET or SET dealers.  The adhesive attaching the hood scoop may weaken, allowing the hood scoop to detach from the vehicle.', u'Remedy': u"SET will notify owners, and dealers will mechanically fasten the scoop to the hood, free of charge.  The recall began on September 1, 2017.  Owners may contact SET customer service at 1-954-429-2000.  SET's number for this recall is SET17B.", u'ModelYear': u'2015', u'Model': u'TACOMA', u'Make': u'TOYOTA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1499054400000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Southeast Toyota Distributors, LLC'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'15V315000', u'Conequence': u'If the operator inflates the tires according to the information on the tire placard, the tires may be underinflated, increasing the risk of tire failure which could result in a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'EQUIPMENT:OTHER:LABELS | TIRES', u'Summary': u'Southeast Toyota Distributors, LLC (SET) is recalling certain model year 2015 Toyota Tundra vehicles manufactured March 11, 2015, to April 11, 2015 and equipped with Nitto Terra Grappler G2 275/60R20 116S XL tires. As such, these vehicles fail to comply with the requirements of Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard (FMVSS) No. 110, "Tire Selection and Rims and Motor Home/Recreation Vehicle Trailer Load Carrying Capacity Information for Motor Vehicles with a GVWR of 4,536 kilograms (10,000 pounds) or less."', u'Remedy': u"SET will notify owners, and dealers will install a new tire placard with the correct cold tire inflation pressure information, free of charge.  The recall began on June 29, 2015.  Owners may contact SET customer service at 1-866-405-4226.  SET's number for this recall is SET15C.", u'ModelYear': u'2015', u'Model': u'TUNDRA', u'Make': u'TOYOTA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1432699200000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Southeast Toyota Distributors, LLC'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'16V420000', u'Conequence': u'An incorrect label may lead an owner to overload the vehicle, increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'EQUIPMENT:OTHER:LABELS', u'Summary': u'Southeast Toyota Distributors, LLC (SET) is recalling certain model year 2016 Toyota Camry and Highlander, 2015-2016 Toyota Tundra, Scion FR-S, and tC vehicles. SET's number for this recall is SET17A.", u'ModelYear': u'2015', u'Model': u'TUNDRA', u'Make': u'TOYOTA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1494475200000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Southeast Toyota Distributors, LLC'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'15V315000', u'Conequence': u'If the operator inflates the tires according to the information on the tire placard, the tires may be underinflated, increasing the risk of tire failure which could result in a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'EQUIPMENT:OTHER:LABELS | TIRES', u'Summary': u'Southeast Toyota Distributors, LLC (SET) is recalling certain model year 2015 Toyota Tundra vehicles manufactured March 11, 2015, to April 11, 2015 and equipped with Nitto Terra Grappler G2 275/60R20 116S XL tires.  These vehicles have a tire placcard that incorrectly states the recommended cold tire inflation pressure.  As such, these vehicles fail to comply with the requirements of Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard (FMVSS) No. 110, "Tire Selection and Rims and Motor Home/Recreation Vehicle Trailer Load Carrying Capacity Information for Motor Vehicles with a GVWR of 4,536 kilograms (10,000 pounds) or less."', u'Remedy': u"SET will notify owners, and dealers will install a new tire placard with the correct cold tire inflation pressure information, free of charge.  The recall began on June 29, 2015.  Owners may contact SET customer service at 1-866-405-4226.  SET's number for this recall is SET15C.", u'ModelYear': u'2015', u'Model': u'TUNDRA', u'Make': u'TOYOTA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1432699200000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Southeast Toyota Distributors, LLC'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'16V420000', u'Conequence': u'An incorrect label may lead an owner to overload the vehicle, increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'EQUIPMENT:OTHER:LABELS', u'Summary': u'Southeast Toyota Distributors, LLC (SET) is recalling certain model year 2016 Toyota Camry and Highlander, 2015-2016 Toyota Tundra, Scion FR-S, and tC vehicles. The recall began on July 14, 2016.  Owners may contact SET customer service at 1-866-405-4226.', u'ModelYear': u'2015', u'Model': u'TUNDRA', u'Make': u'TOYOTA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1465444800000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Southeast Toyota Distributors, LLC'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V311000', u'Conequence': u'Lugnuts that crack and detach may cause the wheels to separate from the vehicle, increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'15V098000', u'Conequence': u'The improperly tightened bolts may loosen during vehicle operation and may potentially cause the wheel to lock up or may damage the rear brake components, reducing their effectiveness. The recall began during April 3, 2015.  Owners may contact Toyota customer service at 1-800-331-4331.', u'ModelYear': u'2015', u'Model': u'YARIS', u'Make': u'TOYOTA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1424322000000-0500)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Toyota Motor Engineering & Manufacturing'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'15V134000', u'Conequence': u'If the vehicles are equipped with a headliner that does not meet the impact requirements, there is an increased risk of occupantl injury in the event of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'STRUCTURE', u'Summary': u'Toyota Motor Engineering & Manufacturing (Toyota) is recalling certain model year 2012-2015 Yaris vehicles manufactured August 31, 2011, to February 9, 2015, and sold or registered in Puerto Rico. As such, these vehicles fail to comply with the requirements of Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard (FMVSS) No. 201, " Occupant Protection in Interior Impact."', u'Remedy': u'Toyota will notify owners, and dealers will replace the headliner, free of charge. ', u'ModelYear': u'2015', u'Model': u'YARIS', u'Make': u'TOYOTA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1425873600000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Toyota Motor Engineering & Manufacturing'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'16V367000', u'Conequence': u'A damaged strut mounting bearing may cause the strut rod to separate, causing a loss of vehicle stability and increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'SUSPENSION:FRONT:SHOCK ABSORBER', u'Summary': u'Toyota Motor Engineering & Manufacturing (Toyota) is recalling certain model year 2015 Yaris vehicles manufactured January 13, 2015, to February 27, 2015. Toyota's number for this recall is G0S.", u'ModelYear': u'2015', u'Model': u'YARIS', u'Make': u'TOYOTA', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1464235200000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Toyota Motor Engineering & Manufacturing'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'19V319000', u'Conequence': u'In the event of a crash, front seat side air bags and curtain shield air bags that do not deploy as intended can increase the risk of injury. ', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'AIR BAGS:SIDE/WINDOW | ELECTRICAL SYSTEM:WIRING', u'Summary': u'Toyota Motor Engineering & Manufacturing (Toyota) is recalling certain 2015-2017 Yaris vehicles. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'14V658000', u'Conequence': u'Vehicle occupants could be injured by falling glass.  A sunroof break during vehicle operation also increases the risk of driver distraction and a resulting vehicle crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'VISIBILITY:SUN ROOF ASSEMBLY', u'Summary': u'Volkswagen Group of America, Inc. (Volkswagen) is recalling certain model year 2013-2015 Beetle vehicles manufactured June 13, 2013, to July 3, 2014.  The glass sunroofs in the affected vehicles may break when the vehicles are operated over a hard road surface or strike a pothole.', u'Remedy': u"Volkswagen will notify owners, and dealers will replace the sunroof, free of charge. The recall began on December 15, 2015. Owners may contact Volkswagen customer service at 1-800-822-8987. ', u'Component': u'FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE:FUEL INJECTION SYSTEM:FUEL RAIL', u'Summary': u'Volkswagen Group of America, Inc. (Volkswagen) is recalling certain model year 2014-2015 Jetta vehicles manufactured March 28, 2014, to November 24, 2014, 2014-2015 Passat vehicles manufactured April 7, 2014, to November 18, 2014, 2015 Golf and GTI vehicles manufactured July 1, 2014, to November 20, 2014, and 2014-2015 Beetle and Beetle Convertible vehicles manufactured March 31, 2014, to November 27, 2014.  A sealing cap at the fuel rail may fail, allowing fuel to leak into the engine compartment.', u'Remedy': u"Volkswagen will notify owners, and dealers will replace the fuel rails with new parts, free of charge.  The recall began February 6, 2015. Owners may contact Volkswagen customer service at 1-800-822-8987.  Volkswagen's number for this recall is 24BL.  Note: This recall expands and supersedes recall 14V-809 (Volkswagen recall number 24Bi) and only affects vehicles not previously repaired under that campaign.


", u'ModelYear': u'2015', u'Model': u'BEETLE', u'Make': u'VOLKSWAGEN', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1421989200000-0500)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Volkswagen Group of America, Inc.'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'15V705000', u'Conequence': u'If the camshaft lobe shears off there would be a loss of brake assist, lengthening the distance needed to stop the vehicle and increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING:ENGINE | SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC:POWER ASSIST:VACUUM', u'Summary': u'Volkswagen Group of America, Inc. ', u'Remedy': u"Volkswagen dealer will update the engine control module (ECM) software. The recall began March 2016.  Owners may contact Volkswagen customer service at 1-800-822-8987. A build-up of silicate on the shift lever micro switch contacts may enable the key to be removed from the ignition when the transmission shift lever is not in "Park."', u'Remedy': u"Volkswagen will notify owners, and dealers will install an additional switch and circuit board, free of charge. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'17V509000', u'Conequence': u'If the fuel pump fails, the engine will stall, increasing the risk of a crash.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE:DELIVERY:FUEL PUMP', u'Summary': u'Volkswagen Group of America, Inc. Volkswagen's number for this recall is 46G4.", u'ModelYear': u'2015', u'Model': u'TOUAREG', u'Make': u'VOLKSWAGEN', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1458792000000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Volkswagen Group of America, Inc.'}, {u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'18V329000', u'Conequence': u'If the vehicles do not meet all regulatory requirements, there could be an increased risk of a crash, fire, or injury.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'UNKNOWN OR OTHER', u'Summary': u'Volkswagen Group of America, Inc. (Volkswagen) is recalling certain 2012-2016 Eos, 2012 Passat, 2012-2016 CC, 2015-2016 e-Golf, 2011-2015 Touareg, 2012-2015 and 2017 Tiguan, and 2011-2016 Golf and 2011-2013 GTI vehicles.  Modifications made while the vehicles were in an internal evaluation period may cause the affected vehicles to not comply with all of the applicable regulatory requirements.', u'Remedy': u'Volkswagen will notify owners, and dealers will repair the vehicles to make them fully compliant or Volkswagen will repurchase them if necessary, free of charge. [{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'19V849000', u'Conequence': u'A door that is not securely latched could open while the vehicle is in motion, increasing the risk of injury to a vehicle occupant.', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'LATCHES/LOCKS/LINKAGES:DOORS:LATCH', u'Summary': u'Volvo Car of USA LLC (Volvo) is recalling certain 2011-2017 S60, S60I, V60, S60CC and V60CC vehicles.  A component within the door latches may break, making the doors difficult to latch and/or leading the driver or a passenger to believe a door is securely closed when, in fact, it is not.', u'Remedy': u"Volvo will notify owners, and dealers will replace all four door latches, free of charge.  The recall is expected to begin January 4, 2020.  Owners may contact Volvo customer service at 1-800-458-1552.  Volvo's number for this recall is R89978.", u'ModelYear': u'2015', u'Model': u'S60', u'Make': u'VOLVO', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1574744400000-0500)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Volvo Car USA LLC'}]

[{u'NHTSACampaignNumber': u'13V377000', u'Conequence': u'Malfunctioning head lamps and/or turn signals increase the risk of a crash.\r\n', u'Notes': u'Owners may also contact the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration Vehicle Safety Hotline at 1-888-327-4236 (TTY 1-800-424-9153), or go to www.safercar.gov.', u'Component': u'ELECTRICAL SYSTEM', u'Summary': u'Volvo is recalling certain model year 2014 S60, S80, XC60 and XC70 vehicles equipped with keyless ignition.  In the affected vehicles, the Central Electronic Module (CEM) will not perform as intended.  As a result, the front windshield wipers might run continuously when the ignition is on.  Also, the turn signals, high beams, and headlight switch might not work. ', u'Remedy': u'Volvo will notify owners, and dealers will upgrade the CEM software, free of charge. The recall began on October 3, 2013.  Owners may contact Volvo at 1-800-458-1552.', u'ModelYear': u'2015', u'Model': u'S80', u'Make': u'VOLVO', u'ReportReceivedDate': u'/Date(1377057600000-0400)/', u'Manufacturer': u'Volvo Cars of N.A., LLC'}]
